H0.text: Become red supergiants is how very massive stars end their lives.

H1.text: Become super novas are the end state of very massive stars.

H2.text: Very massive stars explode at the end of their lives.

H3.text: Consumed by a black hole is the fate of very massive stars when they end their lives.

A4.text: For cores of around 60–130 M☉, the fusion of oxygen and heavier elements is so energetic that the entire star is disrupted, causing a supernova.

A5.text: For cores of 40–60 M☉, the collapse halts and the star remains intact, but collapse will occur again when a larger core has formed.
